name: Twinlife-doc
tagline: Organization of the Twinlife services API
body:
## Welcome to the Twinlife GitHub Pages.

Twinlife services are available for the following native target environments:
* Android: Java
* iOS: Objective C
* Web applications: Javascript and Web Components (Polymere)

For each target environment, Twinlife services are organized as a hierarchy along the following levels:
* Twinlife Base Services: generic twinlife platform services
* Twinlife Add-on Services: services specific to a particular application or extensions to the Twinlife Base Services.

### Twinlife Base Services

#### Management Services
* Configuration
* Events
* Notifications
* Reports

#### Account Services
* Sign Up
* Sign In
* Sign Out

#### Connectivity Services
* Application connection/disconnection
* To Server
* To Internet

#### Roster Services (XMPP)
* Contacts
* Groups
* Invitations

#### Chat Services (XMPP)
* Text chat messages

#### Directory Services
* Name to Object directory (LDAP style)

#### Repository Services
* Object data base (based on PostgreSQL)
* Distributed fine grain mobile objects management

#### WebRTC Services
* Peer connection
* Media stream
* Data channel

#### Twincode Services
* Twincode Factory
* Twincode IN
* Twincode OUT
* Twincode Switch

### Twinlife Add-on Services

#### Twinsee Services
* Roster (XMPP)
* Chat (XMPP)

#### Twinme Services
* Twincodes
* Real-time chat

### Application specific Services
* Twinme typed objects
* Twinme protocol
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
